task_summary: The robot drives through an indoor hallway and reaches a designated goal location.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile platform appears to be navigating down a carpeted corridor with beige walls. The instruction is to reach a goal location, presumably somewhere further along the hallway. The Behavior Tree executes a navigation primitive toward the symbolic target 'goal', aligns yaw to 0째, and then verifies arrival. The environment looks mostly static and uncluttered, so the policy can be simple: move forward toward the goal and confirm final pose without additional manipulation steps.
preconditions: Robot has a known map or waypoint labeled 'goal'.
Hallway ahead is traversable (no major obstacles blocking the path).
Localization is available to evaluate IsAt(target='goal').
stepwise_plan: Drive toward the named waypoint 'goal' with heading 0째.
Check that the robot is now located at 'goal'.
success_criteria: Robot ends aligned generally forward (yaw ~0째) without collision.
failure_and_recovery: If NavigateToNamed fails due to transient blockage, higher-level retry or alternate route selection would be required (not modeled here).
If IsAt returns false, navigation would need to continue refining position.

frame_3.now_evidence: Forward corridor view appears stable and centered, suggesting steady mid-trajectory navigation toward the goal.
frame_3.predicts_next: Indicates continued hallway following; supports that the robot will keep moving along the same bearing to reach the goal.

node_specs.description: Drive the mobile robot toward the symbolic location 'goal' while maintaining yaw 0째 and respecting a 3000 ms timeout bin.
Check if the robot is currently at the named target 'goal'.

failure_modes: Localization drift causes IsAt('goal') to fail even when physically nearby.
recovery_strategy: Replan an alternate path around obstacles.
Escalate to human/operator if repeatedly timing out.
assumptions: All frames show essentially the same corridor with no visible obstacles, so we assume straight-line hallway navigation suffices.
The visual frames do not explicitly reveal any landmark labeled 'goal'; we assume 'goal' lies further along the corridor in the forward direction.
No dynamic agents (people) are modeled; crowd avoidance is out of scope.

expected_success_criteria: The robot reaches the designated goal location in the hallway and remains stationary.
IsAt('goal') evaluates true without further correction.
